headline: Which High-Yield REIT Stock Is Cheaper, Federal Realty Investment Trust or Realty Income?
summary: Both Federal Realty Investment Trust (NYSE: FRT) and Realty Income (NYSE: O) are among the most popular real estate investment trusts (REITs) on the stock market.  A REIT is basically a landlord, so the revenue it draws from its properties is central to its operations and its value for investors.  If you compare the two on a price-to-sales basis, the edge clearly belongs to Federal Realty.
